title: Chill fit
content: So I’ve got into the jogger trend, this is my 3rd different brand, and probably the worst. It is fine but the crotch is low so it’s a funny fit and the fabric is more plastic-y feel (that swishy when you walk) over all it’s not bad but not the best I’ve had. I’m 5’7” 200lbs and bought a large so maybe it’s just my body type for the fit.

title: I love these pants!

title: Verified Purchase
content: These pants are light enough for me to wear on a step machine, and they have a little flexibility, which makes them comfortable when I use weight resistance machines.  The pockets with zippers are helpful.  Their length is OK (and I have fairly long legs).  The price was reasonable. I will be happy to buy another pair of these.  They give adequate warmth for a few minutes outside in the winter.

title: Verified Purchase
content: I always take medium in joggers. The sizing chart for these would also indicate I take a medium. For reference I am 5ft 7 1/2" , 140 lbs and 29" inseam in dress pants.  I was not looking for a slim fit, just tapered legs and a normal fit without bagginess. Returned the medium for a small and it fit well without bagginess!  So size down if you are about like me. Another reviewer said the same. He stated that if you were around 5 ft 8" size down to a small. THe material is thin but seems durable. I live In GA so i did not need some heavy fleece lined joggers, esp .for summer and fall.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2023

title: Size down if you don't want bagginess in the back top part of leg

title: Verified Purchase

title: Comfy
